private_information: I can move the top disk from one peg to another peg
I must move only one disk at a time
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
mover.goal: Contribute a concrete step by step move strategy to relocate all disks from the middle peg to the left peg following the rules

private_information: I see the initial configuration and can report state snapshots and canonical object naming
I can verify that moves in a proposed plan respect top-of-peg and size ordering constraints
observer.goal: Produce a clear canonical representation of pegs and disks and verify state transitions proposed by the mover

private_information: I inspect proposals for temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
I ensure the described plan is physically realizable under the stated rules
auditor.goal: Audit the mover and observer outputs and provide a consistency report that removes any shortcutting or unrealistic bookkeeping

private_information: I integrate inputs from other agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a validated PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi task with 4 disks and 3 pegs and is ready for FastDownwards

public_information: There are three pegs called left peg middle peg and right peg
There are four disks from smallest to largest named disk A disk B disk C disk D
Initial condition: the middle peg holds from top to bottom disk A disk B disk C disk D
Initial condition: the left peg is empty and the right peg is empty
Goal condition: the left peg must hold from top to bottom disk A disk B disk C disk D and the middle peg and right peg must end empty
Allowed action: move the top disk from one peg to another peg
Rules: only one disk may be moved at a time only the top disk on a peg may be moved and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
The right peg may be used as an intermediate but must be empty in the final state

strategy.system_prompt: You are a strategy specialist for sequential manipulation puzzles such as Tower of Hanoi. Produce a deterministic step by step move sequence that moves four disks from the middle peg to the left peg while obeying all rules. Do not emit PDDL. Provide moves in a clear canonical move notation such as move diskA middle left.
strategy.prompt: Your name is mover. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->mover->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->mover->goal} Provide a concrete sequence of moves that respects the rules and the initial and goal states.

report.system_prompt: You are an observer that creates canonical state encodings and validates move legality. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a canonical mapping of pegs and disks and a sequence of state snapshots corresponding to a provided move plan. Flag any move that violates top-of-peg or size ordering constraints.
report.prompt: Your name is observer. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->observer->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->observer->goal} If given a move sequence provide state snapshots after each move and verify legality. Provide canonical object names and a mapping that the orchestrator can consume.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor for temporal and causal consistency. Your job is to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure the proposed plan is causally realizable without hidden tokens or post-hoc corrections. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise report describing any shortcutting issues and corrected minimal changes so the plan remains valid under real sequential execution.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->auditor->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->auditor->goal} Inspect move sequences and state reports and produce a consistency audit and corrective suggestions if needed.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the strategy the state reports and the consistency audit to produce a single coherent PDDL domain and a single coherent PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance described in the public information. You must target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep any agent-level intentions distinct in comments but produce one unified domain and one unified problem. Ensure no reliance on bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure causal temporal consistency.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your inputs are the following artifacts from other agents: strategy_mover: {strategy_mover} state_report_observer: {state_report_observer} consistency_audit: {consistency_audit} You also have public information: {environment->public_information} Your task is to integrate these inputs and produce a validated PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable to be solved by FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If any ambiguity remains reconcile names and document the reconciliation in comments in the PDDL files. Keep actions and predicates clear and minimal and ensure the model enforces only-top-disk moves and disk size ordering constraints.
